text: from Provence ' or cooked wine' is an artisanal dessert wine produced in Provence, France. It is made by heating grape juice without boiling it so that the grape juice becomes contentrated and syrupy. It is then fermented in barrels. The alcohol content is around 14%. is not a fortified wine. Its Italian counterpart is the vino cotto. Production of this wine style is limited. It is regularly served on Christmas Eve. == References == ==See also == * Mulled wine Category:Dessert wine Category:Cuisine of Provence
title: Vin cuit
